qas.question: When did the modern petroleum industry start?
What started the modern petroleum industry ?

answers.text: the discovery of the process of refining kerosene from coal

qas.question: Who discovered the process of refining kerosene from coal?
Who improved Gesner's  of refining kerosene from coal?
Where was the first Rock Oil mine built?

context: The modern petroleum industry started in <a0_0>1846<a0_0/> with <a1_0>the discovery of the process of refining kerosene from coal<a1_0/> by <a2_0>Nova Scotian Abraham Pineo Gesner<a2_0/>. <a3_0>Ignacy Łukasiewicz<a3_0/> improved Gesner's method to develop a means of refining kerosene from the more readily available "rock oil" ("petr-oleum") seeps in 1852 and the first rock oil mine was built in <a4_0>Bóbrka<a4_0/>, near Krosno in Galicia in the following year. In 1854, Benjamin Silliman, a science professor at Yale University in New Haven, was the first to fractionate petroleum by distillation. These discoveries rapidly spread around the world.
